title: Native American Architecture and Place
description: The role of culture and setting in the construction of spatial, material and landscape concepts and artifacts, through the introduction of selected North American cultures, with focus from 1300 AD through contemporary time. 4 lectures. Crosslisted as ARCH/ESÂ 326. Fulfills GE C4 except for Comparative Ethnic Studies majors. Fulfills USCP.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Areas A and C1
